column4: q: where do I look for nfs error messages? what can it be when it says connection refused (2 ubuntu machines)?
rpcinfo -p remote_host
gives me: rpcinfo: can't contact portmapper: RPC: Remote system error - Connection refused
there you go
is portmap started on the other machines, are they even reachable etc..
portmap is installed, and ssh/smb is working
and running?
it should return something like portmapper and nlockmgr when it works
oh.. i remember one thing from debian, it only listens to localhost
now I installed portmap & nfs-common on the client machine too, and it gives me: mount: RPC: Program not registered
portmap needs to be started before any other rpc programs
it still won't work?
start with rpcinfo -p on the local hosts, when that works, it should be ok for remote usage aswell
I actually used the wrong IP.
I'll remember the rpcinfo command tho.
oh, bummer ;),
rpcinfo is useful, and always restart portmap first
there's no GUI for connection nfs shares, no?
smb shares are much (10x) slower here on my wlan, for whatever reason.
same here.. nfs is udp and there's not csma/cd in the wlan afaik so i guess that could have something to do with it
I actually think it's a bug in the samba server (or the client)
you're using ndiswrapper too? (that might be the problem)
no.. regular drivers
